member.name: T:Tekla.Structures.Model.Assembly
member.summary: The Assembly class defines a single manufacturing unit: objects that are bolted or welded together in the workshop. An assembly has a main part and secondary assemblables attached to it. The number of secondaries is limited to 2048. Hierarchical assemblies can also have subassemblies attached to them and they can have a parent assembly instance.

member.name: T:Tekla.Structures.Model.ModelObject
member.summary: The ModelObject class is an abstract base class for all model objects, such as parts, bolts, welds and reinforcements.
member.remarks: One way to find out the correct names of the report properties is to open the Template Editor. With the Template Editor you can see the listing of all the properties that can be added to report templates.

member.name: T:Tekla.Structures.Model.BooleanPart
member.summary: The BooleanPart class represents a part cut or an add. This means that a model object is, for example, cut with a part instance to create a void to the father part. Typically the operative part is deleted after the operation.

member.name: F:Tekla.Structures.Model.BooleanPart.BooleanOperativeClassName
member.summary: A constant string that defines a part class name to be the boolean operative part. This class must be used when inserting the operative part to the database.

member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.Model.BooleanPart.#ctor
member.summary: Instantiates an empty cut operation.

member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.Model.BooleanPart.SetOperativePart(Tekla.Structures.Model.Part)
member.summary: Sets the part to operate with. The operative part's class member must be defined to be BooleanOperativeClass.
member.param: The operative part for the boolean.

member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.Model.BooleanPart.Insert
member.summary: Inserts the boolean part into the model database. All the attributes must be set. The operative part is overwritten by a copy of the original part.

member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.Model.BooleanPart.Select
member.summary: Selects a boolean part from the model database. The part ID must be set.

member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.Model.BooleanPart.Modify
member.summary: Currently it is not possible to modify the boolean part as there is nothing that can be modified for it. Calling this function will actually call modify for the operative part member.

member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.Model.BooleanPart.Delete
member.summary: Deletes the boolean part instance with the given ID from the model database.

member.name: P:Tekla.Structures.Model.BooleanPart.Type
member.summary: Defines the boolean operation: an add or a cut.

member.name: P:Tekla.Structures.Model.BooleanPart.OperativePart
member.summary: The part that does the boolean operation. When Insert() is called, this field is overwritten with a new part instance which is a copy of the original operative part. This part has the same identifier as the boolean part. Modifications (such as profile change) have to be made through the part instance and not the boolean part instance. The operative part's class must be BooleanOperativeClass.

member.summary: Defines the boolean operation: an add or a cut.

member.summary: Defines the add part. Typically the add part type is not used.

member.summary: Defines the cut part.

member.summary: The ComponentInput class handles the input of component objects and positions. A component has one component input. The component input must include all the needed input objects and points in the correct order. For example, an input with a point and a part is different from an input of a part and a point. The maximum number of different input items in the collection is 10.

The zero-based index in the array at which copying begins.

The array is multidimensional, or the index is equal to or greater than the length of the array, or the number of elements in the source is greater than the available space from the index to the end of the destination array.
The type of the source cannot be cast automatically to the type of the destination array.

member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.Model.History.ModelHistory.TakeModifications(System.String,Tekla.Structures.Model.History.ModificationStamp)
member.summary: Take modifications since previous call.
member.remarks: Takes modification which has happened to the model since the previous call to TakeModifications with the same Name argument. If there was no previous call with this Name, shows modifications since beginning, or since PrevStap, if it is specified. Updates internal reference for use when TakeModifications() is called next time.
member.param: Name of reference which is used for collecting modifications and which is updated. Intended use is to assign an unique name for each client application which needs to be informed of the model updates. Maximum length is 79 characters.
When specified, default value of reference if is it not found
member.returns: All modifications which happened since the last call. See ModificationInfo reference

member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.Model.History.ModelHistory.GetModifications(System.String,Tekla.Structures.Model.History.ModificationStamp)
member.summary: Lookup modifications sine previous call of TakeModifications() without resetting the modstamp
member.remarks: Takes modification which has happened to the model since the previous call to TakeModifications with the same Name argument. If there was no previous call of TakeModifications() with this Name, shows modifications since beginning, or since PrevStap, if it is specified.
member.param: Name of reference which is used for collecting modifications and which is updated. Intended use is to assign an unique name for each client application which needs to be informed of the model updates. Maximum length is 79 characters.
When specified, default value of reference if is it not found
member.returns: All modifications which happened since the last call

member.name: T:Tekla.Structures.Model.LoadGroup
member.summary:
The LoadGroup class implements grouping functionality related to all loads. Each load should be assigned to a load group. Each load group contains loads caused by the same action and to which you want to refer collectively.
Tekla Structures assumes that all loads in a group
Have the same partial safety and other combination factors
Have the same action direction
Occur at the same time and all together
You may create new load groups, modify existing ones and delete load groups via the .NET interface. You may also change the assigned load group of a load and list all the load groups found in the model via the ModelObjectSelector interface. The model always has at least one load group.

member.name: P:Tekla.Structures.Model.LoadGroup.Compatible
member.summary:
This variable is used to store information on which groups are compatible with each other in structural analysis load combination.
Load combination is a process in which some simultaneously acting load groups are multiplied by their partial safety factors and combined with each other according to specific rules. To accurately combine loads which have the same load group type, you need to identify which load groups can occur at the same time, i.e. are compatible. This variable stores one integer, and all groups who have this same integer are known to be compatible with each other. Depending on the analysis needs, they may be calculated together, in smaller combinations, or separately.

member.name: P:Tekla.Structures.Model.LoadGroup.Incompatible
member.summary:
This variable is used to store information on which groups exclude each other in structural analysis load combination.
Load combination is a process in which some simultaneously acting load groups are multiplied by their partial safety factors and combined with each other according to specific rules. To accurately combine loads which have the same load group type, you need to identify which load groups exclude each other, i.e. are incompatible. This variable stores one integer, and all groups who have this same integer are known to be incompatible with each other.

member.name: P:Tekla.Structures.Model.LoadGroup.Color
member.summary: The load group color. This variable indicates the color with which all loads that belong to this same group are drawn in Tekla Structures views.

member.name: T:Tekla.Structures.Model.Events
member.summary: The Events class allows the user to register event listeners for model events.
member.remarks:
Asynchronous event handling
Registered event handlers are called asynchronously so that many handlers may be running simultaneously. Event handlers are not guaranteed to be run in the same thread where they were registered. The asynchronous nature of the events requires the use of synchronization constructs on objects and data structures that are not defined to be thread safe.
Microsoft's documentation about the lock statement: http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/c5kehkcz.aspx
Microsoft's documentation about delegates: http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/900fyy8e.aspx
Microsoft's documentation about managed threading: http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/1c9txz50.aspx

member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.Model.Model.CommitChanges
member.summary: Commits the changes made to the model database so far. One commit is something that a user can later on undo with the undo command. A commit also launches the drawing of the changed product model to the visible views. A dependent plug-in should never call CommitChanges, since this would make undo very difficult for the user to do. However, non-dependent plug-ins require a separate commit if new objects are created.

member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.Model.Model.CommitChanges(System.String)
member.summary: Commits the changes made to the model database so far. One commit is something that a user can later on undo with the undo command. A commit also launches the drawing of the changed product model to the visible views. A plug-in should never call CommitChanges, since this would make undo very difficult for the user to do.
member.param: The message to be saved with the commit.

member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.Model.Model.GetWorkPlaneHandler

member.returns: The new work plane handler instance.

member.name: P:Tekla.Structures.Model.ModelObjectEnumerator.SelectInstances
member.summary: Indicates that the instance Select() is called when the 'Current' item is asked from the enumerator. The user can set this to 'false' if no members are ever asked from the instance. This is the case when, for example, asking only a report property from the identifier. Warning: normally the user should not change this value.

member.name: P:Tekla.Structures.Model.ModelObjectEnumerator.AutoFetch
member.summary: Indicates that the objects are fetched from the model when the enumerator is created. Object information is therefore not anymore fetched when 'Current' item is asked from the enumerator. Warning: changing of TransformationPlane after creation of enumerator or during the enumeration requires a separate selection of object for refreshing the values. Property value is used for all enumerators in application

member.name: P:Tekla.Structures.Model.ModelObjectEnumerator.Current
member.summary: The current model object instance active in the enumerator. The value is null if there are no more objects left.

member.summary: The implementation for the Current property required by the IEnumerator. The returned object is always of the type ModelObject.

member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.Model.ModelObjectSelector.GetObjectsByBoundingBox(Tekla.Structures.Geometry3d.Point,Tekla.Structures.Geometry3d.Point)
member.summary: Returns an enumerator of the model objects in the current model colliding with the given geometrical bounding box. Note that this method uses approximate bounding boxes and thus is NOT EXACT, and may return objects not necessarily colliding with the given box but only being somewhere near to it.
member.param: The minimum point of the bounding box.
The maximum point of the bounding box.
member.returns: A model object enumerator of the model objects colliding with the given bounding box.

member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.Model.Operations.Operation.IsNumberingUpToDate(Tekla.Structures.Model.ModelObject)
member.summary: Checks whether the numbering is up-to-date for an assembly, a part or a rebar.
member.param: The model object to check. The object must be an assembly, a part, a rebar or an inherited object.
member.exception: Thrown if the is not of a correct type or if it is not valid.
member.returns: True if the numbering information is up-to-date.

member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.Model.Operations.Operation.IsNumberingUpToDateAll
member.summary:
Checks whether the numbering is up-to-date for every assembly, part and rebar on the model.
Using this method is much faster than checking each object individually.
member.returns: True if the numbering information is up-to-date.

member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.Model.Operations.Operation.CreateReportFromSelected(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary:
Creates a report from the selected objects using the given template name and filename.
If a path is not given in the filename, the file is created to the folder defined with the advanced option XS_REPORT_OUTPUT_DIRECTORY.
If the given folder does not exist, the report creation fails.
See Tekla Structures Help for more information about reports.
member.param: The name of the report template to be used in report creation. The name must contain more than three characters.
The name of the created report. The name must contain more than three characters.
The first title for the created report.
The second title for the created report.
The third title for the created report.
member.exception: Thrown when the or is null.
Thrown when the or is too short.
member.returns: True if the report is created.

member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.Model.Operations.Operation.DisplayReport(System.String)
member.summary:
Opens and displays a report with the given name.
If a path is not given in the filename, the file is searched from the folder defined with the advanced option XS_REPORT_OUTPUT_DIRECTORY.
See Tekla Structures Help for more information about reports.
member.param: The name of the report to display. The name must contain more than three characters.
member.exception: Thrown when the file specified in the is not found or when the is too short.

member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.Model.Operations.Operation.CreateReportFromAll(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary:
Creates a report from all the objects using the given template name and filename.
If a path is not given in the filename, the file is created to the folder defined with the advanced option XS_REPORT_OUTPUT_DIRECTORY.
If the given folder does not exist, the report creation fails.
Internally, this method is asynchronous, and because of that the output file cannot be immediately available.
See Tekla Structures Help for more information about reports.
member.param: The name of the report template to be used in report creation. The name must contain more than three characters.
The name of the created report. The name must contain more than three characters.
The first title for the created report.
The second title for the created report.
The third title for the created report.
member.exception: Thrown when the or is null.
Thrown when the or is too short.
member.returns: True if the report is created.

member.summary:
Creates NC files from the selected parts using the given NC template name.
See Tekla Structures Help for more information about NC files.
member.remarks: PopMarks cannot currently be created through the API.
member.param: The name of the NC setting template to be used in creation.
The name of the folder where NC files are created. If defined, overrides the default folder in the setting template.
member.exception: Thrown when the is not defined.
Thrown when the is null.
member.returns: True if the NC files are created, false if the numbering is not up-to-date or the used configuration is wrong.

member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.Model.Operations.Operation.RunMacro(System.String)
member.summary:
Starts a macro with the given name. Throws an exception if the file is not found.
Macros are saved as *.cs files in the folder defined with the XS_MACRO_DIRECTORY variable.
It is possible to run drawing macros using relative paths.
See Tekla Structures Help for more information about macros.
member.param: The name of the macro to start.

member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.Model.Operations.Operation.IsMacroRunning
member.summary:
Returns true if a macro is running, false otherwise.
Macros are saved as *.cs files in the folder defined with the XS_MACRO_DIRECTORY variable.
See Tekla Structures Help for more information about macros.
member.returns: True if a macro is running.

You can save the model as a web model that can be viewed via the Internet using a web browser (e.g. Internet Explorer).
member.param: The filename to be used.
member.returns: True on success, false on failure.

member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.Model.Operations.Operation.SaveSelectedAsWebModel(System.String)

member.param: The filename to be used.
member.returns: True on success, false on failure.

member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.Model.Operations.Operation.MoveObject(Tekla.Structures.Model.ModelObject,Tekla.Structures.Geometry3d.Vector)
member.summary: Moves the model object using the given translation vector.

remarks.para: Note that the object is moved and updated in the view so ModelObject.Modify() is not needed. Call Modify() only after the object's data has been updated with the ModelObject.Select() method.

member.param: The model object to move.
The vector for moving the object.
member.returns: True on success, false on failure.

member.param: The model object to move.
The coordinate system to move the object from.
The coordinate system to move the object to.
member.returns: True on success, false on failure.

member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.Model.Operations.Operation.DisplayPrompt(System.String)
member.summary: Displays a message in the status bar.
member.remarks:
Prompts
Tekla Structures prefixes the given prompt with "prompt_" and looks for a translation in the prompts.ail file. If the translation (e.g. "prompt_Pick_first_position") is not found in the prompts.ail file, the prompt string is displayed as such. This feature can be used to give already translated strings to the picker.
member.param: The message to display.
member.exception: Thrown when the is null.
member.returns: True if the message could be displayed.

member.name: T:Tekla.Structures.Model.Operations.GuidConversion
member.summary: Conversion of old TS GUIDs to current GUIDs. GUIDs are changed in TS save as operation, this class can be used to convert old GUIDs to current GUIDs. To recognize the need for GUID conversion, application needs to save project GUID and compare to the current project GUID. Note: With big models the instance uses a lot of memory.

member.name: T:Tekla.Structures.Model.TaskDependency
member.summary:
The TaskDependency class represents a dependency between two task objects. Each task may depend on many other tasks, but between two specific tasks only one type of a dependency may exist.
There are four types of dependencies:
FINISH_TO_FINISH (FF)
FINISH_TO_START (FS)
START_TO_FINISH (SF)
START_TO_START (SS)

member.param: The primary task to be used.
The secondary task to be used.

member.name: T:Tekla.Structures.Model.Task
member.summary: The Task class defines a single building site task. It may contain parts, assemblies or other tasks. Tasks may have a hierarchy between them i.e. there are other tasks as subtasks for a parent task. Tasks may also depend on each other, have resources assigned to them or have a single worktype.

member.name: T:Tekla.Structures.Model.BaseRebarGroup
member.summary: The BaseRebarGroup class is an abstract base class that represents reinforcing bar group classes. The reinforcing bar groups derived from the base group are the rebar group, the circled rebar group and the curved rebar group.

member.name: T:Tekla.Structures.Model.Reinforcement
member.summary: The Reinforcement class represents a reinforcement in the model. A reinforcement can either be a mesh, a single rebar, a rebar group or a strand.

member.summary: Maximum on plane offset values.

member.summary: Maximum rebar radius values.

member.summary: Maximum rebar splicing values.

member.summary: Maximum rebar polygons.

member.name: F:Tekla.Structures.Model.Reinforcement._wires
member.summary: Stores the physical rebars from which the RebarMesh consists of. The rebars may be requested one at a time or all in a list, and they contain physical points that single rebar has. These points can both include the hook points or not depending on how the retreiving function is called.

member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.Model.Reinforcement.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the Reinforcement class with empty attributes.

member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.Model.Reinforcement.SelectInnerRebars(System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Selects the physical rebars inside the group. These rebars contain for example physical points of the rebar. The function fetches all physical rebars for the structure. Due to remoting limitations, they may be fetched with several subsequent remote calls when handling a big reinforcement structure. This may cause some overhead. The function is only called once, when first inquiry about the physical rebarsis made.
member.param: Parameter to determine whether the hook points should be included or not.
Parameter to determine whether the polygon points should be moved to avoid clashing or not.

member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.Model.Reinforcement.GetRebarGeometries(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Retrieves a list of physical reinforcing bars (of type RebarGeometry). These objects contain physical points in the 3D space of each reinforcing bar.
member.param: A parameter to determine whether the hook points should be included in the rebar geometry or not.
member.returns: An array list that contains the RebarGeometry objects.

member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.Model.Reinforcement.GetRebarGeometriesWithoutClashes(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Retrieves a list of physical reinforcing bars (of type RebarGeometry). These objects contain physical points in the 3D space of each reinforcing bar as shown in model view. In case rebar polygon clashes with itself, physical points are moved to avoid clashing.
member.param: A parameter to determine whether the hook points should be included in the rebar geometry or not.
member.returns: An array list that contains the RebarGeometry objects.

member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.Model.Reinforcement.IsGeometryValid
member.summary: Tells whether the geometry of a reinforcement object is valid or not.
member.returns: True if the geometry of the reinforcement is valid, false otherwise.

member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.Model.Reinforcement.GetNumberOfRebars
member.summary: Returns the number of rebars in the reinforcing group.
member.returns: The number of rebars in the rebar group.

member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.Model.Reinforcement.GetSingleRebar(System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns a single rebar inside the rebar group located by the given index. The indexing starts from the start point. The rebar represents a physical reinforcing bar and contains physical points in the 3D space of the bar. The method returns null on error, for example if given an erroneous index. The number of rebars in the group can be requested with GetNumberOfRebars().
member.param: The index of the rebar in the group.
A parameter to determine whether the hook points should be included in the rebar geometry or not.
member.returns: The instance of a RebarGeometry object that contains the point list of the single physical reinforcing bar. Null if the given index was not valid.

member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.Model.Reinforcement.GetSingleRebarWithoutClash(System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns a single rebar inside the rebar group located by the given index. The indexing starts from the start point. The rebar represents a physical reinforcing bar and contains physical, non-clashing points in the 3D space of the bar. The method returns null on error, for example if given an erroneous index. The number of rebars in the group can be requested with GetNumberOfRebars().
member.param: The index of the rebar in the group.
A parameter to determine whether the hook points should be included in the rebar geometry or not.
member.returns: The instance of a RebarGeometry object that contains the point list of the single physical reinforcing bar. Null if the given index was not valid.

member.summary: Method for getting the solid information of the reinforcement.
member.returns: The solid instance of the reinforcement.

member.summary: Internal method for transforming struct received over .NET interface into RebarGeometry class. NOTE: The struct transfers several geometries at once in order to minimize overhead. Therefore the struct does not correspond 1-to-1 to the RebarGeometry class.

member.name: T:Tekla.Structures.Model.RebarHookData
member.summary: The RebarHookData class defines the hook at the end of a reinforcing bar. Hooks are used for anchoring purposes.

member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.Model.RebarHookData.#ctor
member.summary: Instantiates a rebar hook data instance with empty members.

member.name: P:Tekla.Structures.Model.RebarHookData.Shape
member.summary:
Defines the shape of the hook. The options are:
NO_HOOK. Sets the angle, radius and length to 0.
HOOK_90_DEGREES.
HOOK_135_DEGREES.
HOOK_180_DEGREES.
CUSTOM_HOOK. The angle, radius and length values have to be set manually.

member.name: P:Tekla.Structures.Model.RebarHookData.Angle
member.summary: The angle of the hook.

member.name: P:Tekla.Structures.Model.RebarHookData.Radius
member.summary: The bending radius of the hook. The value is between -180 and +180 degrees.

member.name: P:Tekla.Structures.Model.RebarHookData.Length
member.summary: The length of the straight part of the hook.

member.name: T:Tekla.Structures.Model.RebarHookData.RebarHookShapeEnum
member.summary: The different hook shapes.

member.name: F:Tekla.Structures.Model.RebarHookData.RebarHookShapeEnum.NO_HOOK
member.summary: No hook.

member.name: F:Tekla.Structures.Model.RebarHookData.RebarHookShapeEnum.HOOK_90_DEGREES
member.summary: The standard 90-degree hook.

member.name: F:Tekla.Structures.Model.RebarHookData.RebarHookShapeEnum.HOOK_135_DEGREES
member.summary: The standard 135-degree hook.

member.name: F:Tekla.Structures.Model.RebarHookData.RebarHookShapeEnum.HOOK_180_DEGREES
member.summary: The standard 180-degree hook.

member.name: F:Tekla.Structures.Model.RebarHookData.RebarHookShapeEnum.CUSTOM_HOOK
member.summary: The custom hook shape to manually define the angle, radius and length of a hook.

member.summary: The clearance between joined bars in the case of the lap type splice.

member.summary: Value 0: Joined bars on top of each other in the case of the lap type splice. Value 1: Joined bars parallel to each other in the case of the lap type splice.

member.name: T:Tekla.Structures.ModelInternal.AreWeUnitTesting
member.summary: This is to enable unit-testing specific features like faking TS connection. This class hold a flag that is set to true when user wants to prevent DelegateProxy's static constructor from running and creating IPC connection.

member.name: P:Tekla.Structures.ModelInternal.AreWeUnitTesting.Value
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether we are running in unit testing environment where ICDelegate is replaced with a fake.

member.name: T:Tekla.Structures.ModelInternal.Synchronize
member.summary: Synchronization class for .NET picking and synced commands where we start a command and wait for it to complete.

member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.ModelInternal.Synchronize.Sync
member.summary: Releases the sync handle. Called from TeklaStructures.exe

member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.ModelInternal.Synchronize.WaitForSynchronization
member.summary: Waits until sync handle is released.

member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.ModelInternal.Synchronize.Reset
member.summary: Reset the sync handle

member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.ModelInternal.Synchronize.GetSyncCallback
member.summary: Get sync callback to Sync()

members.member:
CDelegate includes all the platform invoke commands user process can call. It uses CDelegateSynchronized to deliver the calls to C-interface.
Adding a new class to interface goes like this: 1. Add a new delegate function type to definitions in this class. 2. Add Create/Select/Modify functions according to examples to this class. 3. Add Matching EndInvoke function to CDelegateSynchronized class. 4. Add Create/Select/Modify functions according to examples to CDelegateSynchronized 5. Add public static extern int functions for Create/Select/Modify to the end of CDelegateSynchronized. 6. Implement the static functions to TS. 7. Test

The second plane point.

The third plane point.
member.returns: An enumerator for an array list of intersection point lists.

member.name: T:Tekla.Structures.Model.UI.Mesh
member.summary: The Mesh class represents a mesh for drawing three-dimensional data.

member.summary: Creates a new empty mesh instance.

member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.Model.UI.Mesh.#ctor(System.Collections.ArrayList,System.Collections.ArrayList,System.Collections.ArrayList)
member.summary: Creates a new mesh instance with the given points, triangles and lines. Does not check the indices in the given triangles and lines array lists for correctness.
member.param: An array list of point objects representing the mesh points. Null represents no points.

An array list of indices (of type integer) pointing to the points array list. Three consecutive indices represent a single triangle. The first index is 0. If null, the mesh will not contain any triangles.
An array list of indices (of type integer) pointing to the points array list. Two consecutive indices represent a single line. The first index is 0. If null, the mesh will not contain any lines.

member.summary: Returns an enumerator of the given view's visible model objects that collide with the given geometrical bounding box. Note that this method uses approximate bounding boxes and thus is NOT EXACT, and may return objects not necessarily colliding with the given box but only being somewhere near to it.
member.param: The minimum point of the bounding box.
The maximum point of the bounding box.
The view to get the objects from.
member.returns: A model object enumerator of the visible model objects colliding with the given bounding box.

member.name: T:Tekla.Structures.Model.UI.Picker
member.summary: The Picker class can be used to query the user to do manual picks of objects and points from the Tekla Structures model. The methods throw an exception if the user interrupts (cancels) the pick command.
member.remarks:
Prompts
Tekla Structures prefixes the given prompt with "prompt_" and looks for a translation in the prompts.ail file. If the translation (e.g. "prompt_Pick_first_position") is not found in the prompts.ail file, the prompt string is displayed as such. This feature can be used to give already translated strings to the picker.

member.name: T:Tekla.Structures.ModelInternal.dotTemporaryStatesEnum
member.summary: The possible temporary states. Used to temporarily change color of a model object to visualize some state in the model. Only use a state for its named purpose. If you need to make some part orange even though it is not a modified part, talk to TORI or ERFA about adding a new state. Do not use DOT_TEMPORARY_STATE_MODIFIED unless the part is actually modified.

member.name: T:Tekla.Structures.Model.LogicalWeld
member.summary: The LogicalWeld class represents a group of welds in the model. A logical weld contains a list of children welds. The primary properties need to be the same in all the children welds.

member.name: F:Tekla.Structures.Model.LogicalWeld._LogicalWeldList
member.summary: List of children welds of this Logical Weld.

member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.Model.LogicalWeld.#ctor(Tekla.Structures.Model.BaseWeld)
member.summary: Creates a new logical weld instance.
member.param: The main weld for the logical weld.

member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.Model.LogicalWeld.AddWeld(Tekla.Structures.Model.BaseWeld)
member.summary: Adds a weld to the logical weld.
member.param: The weld to be added.

member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.Model.LogicalWeld.GetMainWeld
member.summary: Returns the main weld of the logical weld.
member.returns: The main weld of the logical weld.

member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.Model.LogicalWeld.SetMainWeld(Tekla.Structures.Model.BaseWeld)
member.summary: Sets the main weld for the logical weld.
member.param: The weld to be set as the main weld.

member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.Model.LogicalWeld.RemoveWeld(Tekla.Structures.Model.BaseWeld)
member.summary: Removes a weld from the logical weld.
member.param: The weld to be removed.

member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.Model.LogicalWeld.Explode
member.summary: Removes the logical weld from the model but not the children welds.

member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.Model.LogicalWeld.Insert
member.summary: Inserts the logical weld into the model database. All the attributes must be set.

member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.Model.LogicalWeld.Select
member.summary: Selects a logical weld from the model database. The logical weld identifier must be set.

member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.Model.LogicalWeld.Select(Tekla.Structures.Model.BaseWeld)
member.summary: Selects the logical weld that a child weld belongs to.
member.param: A child weld whose logical weld we want to select.

member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.Model.LogicalWeld.Modify
member.summary: Modifies the existing logical weld in the model database to match the current one.

member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.Model.LogicalWeld.Delete
member.summary: Deletes the logical weld instance with the given identifier from the model database and also the children welds.

member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.Model.LogicalWeld.AddWeldCheck(Tekla.Structures.Model.BaseWeld)
member.summary: Checks that Weld can be added to the Logical Weld.

member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.Model.LogicalWeld.GetMainWeldId
member.summary: Returns the Main Weld Identifier of this Logical Weld.
member.returns: Returns the Main Weld Identifier of this Logical Weld. Returns 0 if there are no welds in this Logical Weld.

member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.Model.LogicalWeld.CopyPrimaryProperties(Tekla.Structures.Model.BaseWeld)
member.summary: Copies the attributes of the Main Weld to the attributes of the Logical Weld (Logical Weld attributes = Main Weld attributes).

member.name: T:Tekla.Structures.Model.Weld
member.summary: The Weld class represents a normal weld in the model. A normal weld has a main part and a secondary part.

member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.Model.Weld.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new weld instance.

member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.Model.Weld.Insert
member.summary: Inserts the weld into the model database. All the attributes must be set.

member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.Model.Weld.Select
member.summary: Selects a weld from the model database. The weld identifier must be set.

member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.Model.Weld.Modify
member.summary: Modifies the existing weld in the model database to match the current one. The modification cannot be done if the weld is a part of a logical weld.

member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.Model.Weld.Delete
member.summary: Deletes the weld instance with the given identifier from the model database.

member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.Model.Weld.GetLogicalWeld(Tekla.Structures.Model.LogicalWeld@)
member.summary: Gets the logical weld where the weld belongs. Returns false if the weld does not belong to any logical weld.
member.param: An initialized logical weld object.
member.returns: True if the logical weld was selected correctly; false otherwise.

member.name: P:Tekla.Structures.Model.Weld.Position
member.summary: Defines the position. Use of Direction is preferred over this.

member.name: P:Tekla.Structures.Model.Weld.Direction
member.summary: Defines the Weld edge search direction normalized to length 1000.0. Overrides Position if set.

member.summary: The PolygonWeld class represents a polygon weld in the model. A polygon weld has a main part and a secondary part.

member.summary: Creates a new polygon weld instance.

member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.Model.PolygonWeld.Insert
member.summary: Inserts the polygon weld into the model database. All the attributes must be set.

member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.Model.PolygonWeld.Select
member.summary: Selects a polygon weld from the model database. The polygon weld identifier must be set.

member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.Model.PolygonWeld.Modify
member.summary: Modifies the existing polygon weld in the model database to match the current one. The modification cannot be done if the polygon weld is a part of a logical weld.

member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.Model.PolygonWeld.Delete
member.summary: Deletes the polygon weld instance with the given identifier from the model database.

member.summary: Gets the logical weld where the weld belongs. Returns false if the weld does not belong to any logical weld.
member.param: An initialized logical weld object.
member.returns: True if the logical weld was selected correctly; false otherwise.
